oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Population structure and symbiotic relationships of the invasive species Sinanodonta woodiana (Lea, 1834) in water bodies of Ukraine
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yermoshyna, Tetiana
Pavliuchenko, Оlesia
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: invasive species
Sinanodonta woodiana
population structure
Ukraine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>Understanding the process of penetration and distribution of the invasive species <jats:italic>Sinanodonta woodiana</jats:italic> is important for predicting associated changes in biodiversity and the structure of freshwater communities. The biomass, density, age and sex structure of mollusk populations were analyzed. An increase in the size of Chinese pond mussels was noted after the introduction: the shell length of individuals from a pond (Romanivka village, 2017) was 24,2% more than of mollusks from the Velyka Repida river (Matroska village, 2004), and in 2019 it increased by another 14,7% (by 42,5% compared to the shell length of the mollusks from the Velyka Repida river). The body weight of <jats:italic>S. woodiana</jats:italic> from the river was 125,3 g, while in the pond there was a 2,13-fold increase in body weight in 2017, with a further increase in this indicator by another 23,6% in 2019 and another 37,7% in 2020. The relative number of <jats:italic>S. woodiana</jats:italic> and native species <jats:italic>Unio pictorum</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>Anodonta anatina</jats:italic> in 2017 was 26,3%, 47,4% and 26,3%, in 2020 – 64,0%, 16,0% and 20,0% respectively. Ciliates of the genus <jats:italic>Conchophthirus</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>Trichodina</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>Aspidogaster conchicola</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>Helobdella stagnalis</jats:italic>, larvae of <jats:italic>Chironomus</jats:italic> sp. are in a symbiotic relationship with <jats:italic>S. woodiana</jats:italic>. The most common <jats:italic>Conchophthirus</jats:italic> sp. – in 21,6% of individuals. Further spread of <jats:italic>S. woodiana</jats:italic> to the cold regions of Ukraine and the formation of new populations in the already developed regions should be expected.</jats:p>
